author: sandra_johnson
content: <@!532654603238375425> Does BloxRoute make their propagation times available to the Ethereum community to download a subset to a dataset to work with and to visualise? I notice (as you warned ðŸ˜‰ ) that the propagation times graph on bdnexplorer does not display currently & the actual values reported are also zero.  I will follow conversations on the bloXroute discord to see when the data is available again. Certainly sounds awesome to be able to gather propagation information from so many nodes!

author: uri_bloxroute
content: <@!688889240125308981> We aim to be as helpful to the community as possible, but to avoid crosswires I suggest you ask for the data in the bloxroute discord, and either bxsupport or Eyal will take it from there

author: uri_bloxroute
content:
jhancock76 - you can see some of my analysis of block propagation here:
https://medium.com/bloxroute/ethereums-recent-gas-rate-increase-5a724a7ebfc
basically I used the number of uncles to deduce the % of miners receiving the block and started to work on the same template, broken down to 50 ms buckets. Basically, nobody moved to the next template within 50 ms, but 20% moved within 150 ms, etc. I then further broke it down to individual pools
It's a nifty analysis, if I may say so on my own work
